title: Historical Stock Splits and Corporate Actions for SL Green Realty Corp

content.text: SL Green Realty Corp completes its initial public offering, listing on the New York Stock Exchange under the ticker symbol 'SLG'.
SL Green Realty Corp executes a 2-for-1 stock split, effectively doubling the number of outstanding shares. This split aims to increase liquidity and make the stock more accessible to investors.
SL Green Realty Corp announces a 2-for-1 stock split, further doubling the number of outstanding shares. This split is implemented to maintain reasonable trading prices and enhance marketability.

SL Green Realty Corp completes the spin-off of its New York City suburban office portfolio into a separate publicly traded REIT, known as 'SL Green Realty Corp - Office Properties'. Shareholders of SLG receive shares in the new entity, and SLG retains its focus on prime Manhattan office properties.

content.section: August 2020: Corporate Action - Sale of Interest
content.text: SL Green Realty Corp sells a 40% interest in 220 East 42nd Street to RXR Realty LLC, generating proceeds of approximately $528 million. This transaction represents a strategic partnership and aims to reinforce SL Green's development pipeline.

content.section: October 2020: Corporate Action - Sale of Interest
content.text: SL Green Realty Corp sells a 48.7% interest in 605 West 42nd Street to Brookfield Asset Management, generating net cash proceeds of approximately $62 million. This sale allows SL Green to monetize a portion of its investment.

SL Green Realty Corp acquires a 95% interest in two Manhattan office buildings, 635 Madison Avenue and 2 Herald Square, for approximately $480 million. This acquisition aligns with SL Green's strategic focus on prime Manhattan properties.

SL Green Realty Corp executes a 3-for-2 stock split, increasing the number of outstanding shares by 50%. This split aims to enhance liquidity and affordability, thereby attracting a wider range of investors.
